net.opentsdb.core

Class RateOptions

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.opentsdb.core.RateOptions

  • public class RateOptions
extends Object
    Provides additional options that will be used when calculating rates. These options are useful when working with metrics that are raw counter values, where a counter is defined by a value that always increases until it hits a maximum value and then it "rolls over" to start back at 0.

    These options will only be utilized if the query is for a rate calculation and if the "counter" options is set to true.

    Since:
    2.0

    • Constructor Detail

      • RateOptions

        public RateOptions()
        Ctor

      • RateOptions

        public RateOptions(boolean counter,
           long counter_max,
           long reset_value)
        Ctor
        Parameters:
        counter - If true, indicates that the rate calculation should assume that the underlying data is from a counter
        counter_max - Specifies the maximum value for the counter before it will roll over and restart at 0
        reset_value - Specifies the largest rate change that is considered acceptable, if a rate change is seen larger than this value then the counter is assumed to have been reset

    • Method Detail

      • isCounter

        public boolean isCounter()
        Returns:
        Whether or not the counter flag is set

      • getCounterMax

        Returns:
        The counter max value

      • getResetValue

        public long getResetValue()
        Returns:
        The optional reset value for anomaly suppression

      • setIsCounter

        public void setIsCounter(boolean counter)
        Parameters:
        counter - Whether or not the time series should be considered counters

      • setCounterMax

        public void setCounterMax(long counter_max)
        Parameters:
        counter_max - The value at which counters roll over

      • setResetValue

        public void setResetValue(long reset_value)
        Parameters:
        reset_value - A difference that may be an anomaly so suppress it
